Recognizing the importance of emotional connections and information sharing during these gatherings, it strives to assist individuals in defining and planning their moments - to elevate the overall impact and connection within diverse social gatherings. This platform aims to solve a problem in a market that is fragmented, with most competition often focusing only on venue solutions, artists/entertainers, or weddings. We recommend launching fast, focusing on high-value propositions, and providing a fluid experience with a beautifully designed user interface.

I need help in enhancing the user experience of an existing website and require assistance in drafting a project brief.

Axioned Project Brief: Revamping Website UX/UI with Interactive Data Visualization

Project Overview and Goals
The project aims to enhance the user experience of an existing website by improving navigation and accessibility. This includes simplifying the navigation menu, grouping content into clear categories, and featuring data and scores related to a specific index on the homepage. Interactive data visualization tools will be implemented for better comprehension. Country-specific pages will showcase performance metrics alongside global data, with tailored messaging for different user groups. A user-friendly backend interface will be developed for efficient content management.

Timeline
Phase
Activities
Duration
1
Define & Prepare
1 Week
2
Design (UX/UI)
3 Weeks
3
Build, Test, and Launch
4-5 Weeks
Total Estimated Timeline
8-9 Weeks

Warranty Period
2 Weeks

Scope:
In-Scope Activities
Phase 1: Define & Prepare:
Conduct project kick-off and preparation activities.
Re-confirm project goals, expectations, and any "offline activities" tied to these goals/deliverables.
Review the client's requirements in further detail, including all client inputs received to date, including Q&A.
Run through the respective Statement of Work (SOW) details.
Introduce team members and confirm their roles and responsibilities.
Review and discuss the draft project plan.
Firm up project management and communication tools to be used throughout the project.
Reconfirm Phase 2/Design assumptions and deliverables, including additional Client Deliverables/inputs needed (e.g., Imagery, branding, etc.).
Reconfirm the approach to UX writing (English/language/words to be used for headings, titles, descriptions, explainers, etc.).
Reconfirm the process and timeline for the project.
Reconfirm Phase 3 assumptions and deliverables, including Phase 2/Build Prep requirements, Tech-Stack Considerations, Go-Live/Deployment, QA/Testing Considerations & Activities.
Reconfirm code repository, development, and UAT hosting environment details, and whether an existing environment (GitHub, hosting, etc.) will be used or if a new one will be created (for which we'll take ownership).
Reconfirm the Highchart license conversation.
Note: If we're going to use an existing environment (GitHub, hosting, etc.), we would require access to the repository/codebase and existing project technical documentation (if available) in case of any issues with environment setup or questions.


End of Phase 1: Review and revise (if needed) timeline/cost for Phase 2/Design and Phase 3/Build. Obtain Client approval.


Phase 2: Design (UX/UI):
Our UX/UI team will collaborate closely with the rest of the team and the client to provide design support for Phase 3/Build. Potential deliverables include:

Creation of an inspiration/mood board in Miro or a similar tool.
Using Figma for UX/UI redesigns.
Testing and experimenting with various presentation/layout options using Highchart.
Clarification of UX writing details in Phase 1.
Expected feedback/revision rounds: 2-3, with the third round for the end-client’s final approval




Phase 2: Build Prep
During this phase, we will assess the necessity of the following steps, reconfirming in Phase 1 if required:

Reviewing the existing site's codebase and documentation, including file/folder architecture, code implementation, graphical/visualization implementation, plugins/libraries used, and deployment process.
If the existing build/code is to be utilized, confirm if there are any additional considerations beyond the Phase 3/Build scope, such as security issues.
Firming up the approach and plan for Phase 3: Build, Test, and Launch.



End of Phase 2: Review and revise (if needed) timeline/cost for Phase 3/Build. Obtain Client approval.


Phase 3: Build, Test, and Launch:
This phase involves executing the approach and plan identified during Phase 2: Build Prep. It includes:
Redeveloping the UI for specific pages/sections, as confirmed during Phases 1 and 2:
Home Page
Map section with interactions
Table representation for easy viewing of indicators and sub-indicators
Global Average Sections
About Us page (Entire Page) to be designed as a web page with respect to brand styling considerations
Compare page (Entire Page) to provide more in-depth exploration for users into indicators and sub-indicators
Countries Profile: Entire Page
Banner section cleanup
Redesigning Graph Sections as per indicator and sub-indicator visual requirements
Redesigning Countries static data section to present more data with a good user experience
Explore Page: Sections to be replicated as the Home Page
Navigation section with logo to achieve cross-linking with Youth Hub
Implementing the Pulse Survey Feature for the client/marketing team to assess results or sentiment of users over time. Questions to come from the client.
Implementing features/functionalities considered across the website (to be re-evaluated during Phase 1):
Video integration optimized to embed from YouTube
Country mapping with pin enlargement animation
Filter with attributes for countries with Excel download
Section Pagination
PDF download
Carousel/slider
Country mapping with pin enlargement animation
Excel download
Graphical Views for data comparison
Data comparison with attributes/indicators
Implementing Analytics: Google Analytics & Custom Event Tracking via GTM. This is currently implemented. However, the Client doesn’t have access. We’re going to have to either get access or create a new. Revisit during Phase 1.

All these activities will be revisited and reviewed during Phases 1 and 2 to ensure alignment with the project goals and client expectations.


Out of Scope Activities:
It’s already assumed that the Client has a GitHub OR BitBucket SVN set-up (for code and code commit management). If not, Axioned will gladly set this up on the Client’s behalf. The Client will own all aspects of this set-up; including billing/payment.
Hosting environment and infrastructure costs. 
Any maintenance-related activities.
Any 3rd-party software licenses, and/or plugin costs. Any decisions made by Axioned re: 3rd-party templates/plugin costs, etc. will be made with the approval of the Client.
Any activities not explicitly detailed as in scope within the above in-scope items. If such activities need to be performed post-scope approval, these shall be handled as Additional Requests/”Extending Services to Accommodate Scale”.


Technical Considerations
CMS - WordPress (Existing)
Language: Html, CSS, JS (React, other JS libraries as per requirement)
Graphic JS: Highcharts.js
Analytics - GA/GTM




Deliverables:
Redeveloped UI for specific pages/sections.
Implemented features/functionalities across the website.
Implemented Pulse Survey Feature.
Implemented Analytics: Google Analytics & Custom Event Tracking via GTM.




Resources:
Project Manager
UX/UI Designer
Frontend Developer
Backend Developer
QA/Testing Specialist


Budget:
Based on the scope and timeline provided, a rough budget estimate for this project could range from $50,000 to $100,000, depending on the specific requirements, complexity of design and development, and the rates of the resources involved.

Designing immersive and user-friendly UX/UI interfaces tailored for iOS and Android devices.
Implementing advanced functionalities such as secure user authentication, real-time session updates, personalized push notifications, and multimedia content delivery.
Integrating comprehensive event-related content, including session details, speaker profiles, venue information, and multimedia resources.
Conducting rigorous QA/testing processes to ensure a seamless user experience across devices and operating systems.
Incorporating feedback from user acceptance testing (UAT) to refine app features and enhance user satisfaction.
Deploying and launching the app on major app stores, utilizing effective app store optimization (ASO) strategies.

The project entails the development of a Software as a Service (SaaS) platform focused on skincare management. The platform will enable users to efficiently manage their skincare routines, monitor product usage, and receive personalized recommendations. The primary objective is to deliver a user-friendly solution that empowers individuals to enhance their skin health and appearance effectively.

Skincare Routine Creation and Tracking: Develop functionality for users to create and manage their skincare routines, including adding products, setting usage frequencies, and tracking progress.
Integrate a comprehensive database of skincare products, including details such as ingredients, usage instructions, and reviews.
Implement algorithms to provide users with personalized skincare product recommendations based on their skin type, concerns, and past usage data.
Develop a dashboard for users to view analytics and reports on their skincare routines, product usage, and skin health improvements over time.

E-commerce functionality
Medical advice or diagnosis
